702292f-b.text:
3rd Avenue (left), north from 36th Street. The buildings on the east side of the avenue were all torn down to make way for the construction of Gowanus Parkway, Brooklyn's northerly link in the Belt Parkway system of highways. On the west side of the avenue are the Bush Terminal buildings. View 2 is north from 34th Street and view 3 shows a closeup of one of the Bush Terminel buildings.
October, 1940
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

702723f-b.text:
36th Street, west across Third Avenue, showing piles on the east side of the avenue for the construction of Gowanus Parkway. Shown, too, are Bush Terminal warehouse, and tenements on the west side of Third Avenue.
P.L. Sperr
January 11, 1941

702723f-a.text:
36th Street, west across Third Avenue, showing piles on the east side of the avenue for the construction of Gowanus Parkway. Shown, too, are Bush Terminal warehouse, and tenements on the west side of Third Avenue.
P.L. Sperr
January 11, 1941

702293f-a.text:
3rd Avenue (left), north from 36th Street, showing the area on the east side of the avenue where all buildings were razed and where the Gowanus Parkway is under construction. On the west side of the avenue are the Bush Terminal warehouses.
View 3 is at 33rd Street.
P. L. Sperr  January 11, 1941
NO EEPRODUCTIONS  Views 1-3
